metadata.title: Adv. Nat. GK Diploma: Defend the goal or the space
metadata.author: Karsten Nielsen
metadata.desired_outcome: Goalkeeper decision-making: defend the goal or the space

drills.name: Coach-Goalkeeper(s)

setup.description: Coach plus at least 2 goalkeepers (rotate goalkeepers between repetitions). 1 goalkeeper in goal, coach at the edge of the PK area, other goalkeeper (S) to the side of coach (both sides if 3 goalkeepers). Alternate left/right after every shot (S change side if only one). Rotate goalkeepers after 4 shots.

diagram.description: Penalty area drill showing a goalkeeper in goal (green), a coach/server at the edge of the penalty area (yellow), and another goalkeeper to the left side. Numbered arrows (1-5) show the ball movement sequence: coach kicks to GK, GK returns, coach passes to server S, S shoots on goal, GK must defend.

sequence: (1) Coach kicks off ground for GK to handle (Contour or basket catch)
(2) GK bowls ball back to coach
(3) Coach makes 1 touch pass to S (other GK), at varying distance from goal
(5) GK must either stay (defend the goal), or come out (smother/block/spread)
coaching_points: Stay or go ("If you cannot affect the ball, protect the goal")
Smother, block or spread (when coming out)
Timing ("Transfer the pressure to the striker", don't commit too early, stay big)
progressions: Unannounced whether left/right (if one GK serving, start position behind coach, move left/right as ball is returned (2))

drills.name: Coach-Goalkeeper(s)-Field Players

setup.description: Goalkeeper plus 4 field players (or use additional GKs and rotate every 5 shots). 2 mannequins. 2 servers 5 yards outside PK area, centered between mannequins. 2 servers at PK area edge, outside of mannequins.

diagram.description: Third-of-pitch drill showing a goal at top with GK (green), a reserve GK behind the goal to the right (green). Two blue mannequins are placed centrally. Four red field players (servers) are positioned: two outside the mannequins at the PK area edge, and two further out. Numbered arrows show a passing and shooting sequence.

sequence: (1) S2 passes the ball to GK
(2) GK passes the ball to S3 (1 touch)
(3) S3 can either: shoot directly, pass to other server outside PK area (receiving server repeats (3)), or pass to other server inside PK area (varying distance from goal)
(4) S entering the PK area shoots on goal (any number of touches, but straight to goal)
(5) GK must either stay (defend the goal), or come out (smother/block/spread)
coaching_points: Stay or go ("If you cannot affect the ball, protect the goal")
Starting position (distance + angle, beware of direct shots)
Body shape when ball outside PK area (front foot, half open)
Smother, block or spread (when coming out)
Timing ("Transfer the pressure to the striker", don't commit too early, stay big)
progressions: 2 servers can enter the PK area (allow 1 pass)

drills.name: Coach-Goalkeeper(s)-Team

setup.description: 4v4+3 (floating players, always on offense) with GKs. Narrow (width of penalty area plus 3 yards on either side). Long (half a field plus space for a second PK area). Use extra field players to rotate floating players often (expected to play box to box).
setup.area_dimensions: Width of PK area + 3 yds each side, length of half field

diagram.description: Between-half-and-full pitch setup showing two goals with GKs (green). Three teams visible: red (4 players), blue (4 players), and yellow (3 floating players). The pitch is narrowed to roughly penalty area width. Players are distributed across the field in game-like positions.

rules: Defenders cannot enter own PK area before the ball is in own half (Motivation: Force a high line)
scoring: 2 pts if score and all 4 defenders in attacking half
1 point if score and all 4 defenders ahead of own PK area
coaching_points: Connected with defenders (close enough to defend the space behind, move up/down with defense)
Stay or go ("If you cannot affect the ball, protect the goal")
Smother, block or spread (when coming out)
Timing ("Transfer the pressure to the striker", don't commit too early, stay big)
Communication with defenders (push up, drop, keeper, back to keeper)
